And I think we are one of those couples with a long story when people ask how we found each other. I will see her every now and then, and maybe one year, she'll be with somebody, and the next year, I'll be with somebody and it's gonna take a long time. And then it's perfect. I'm in no rush.]]> 5 Company Picnic May 14, 2009 Pam Beesly [about her volleyball skills]
Pam Beesly: Maybe I played a little in junior high and in high school. Maybe a little in college. And went to volleyball camp most summers!]]> 5 Company Picnic May 14, 2009 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: Normally, I don't condone leaving early, but I have an appointment with the horse doctor. How that horse became a doctor, I don't know. No, I'm kidding. He's just a regular doctor who shoots your horse in the head when its leg is broken.]]> 5 Company Picnic May 14, 2009 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: Rolf is my best friend. We met a shoe store. I heard him asking for a shoe that could increase his speed and not leave any tracks.]]> 5 Company Picnic May 14, 2009 Michael Scott [trying to stall the volleyball game until Pam returns]
Dwight Schrute: How many people need to get hurt before we learn a valuable lesson? One? Two? Three? Four?
David Wallace: Dwight...
Dwight Schrute: No, no. Hear me out. Five? Six?
David Wallace: Dwight.
Dwight Schrute: Seven? Can I finish, please?
David Wallace: Okay.
Dwight Schrute: Eight?]]> 5 Company Picnic May 14, 2009 Michael Scott Michael Scott: Holly and I can never be just friends. I wrote down a list of bullet points why Holly and I should be together, and I'm going to find the perfect moment today and I'm going to tell her. Number one, "Holly, you and I are soup snakes." And the reason is because in terms of the soup, we like to... That doesn't make any sense. We're soul mates. Holly and I are soul mates.]]> 6 Gossip September 17, 2009 Michael Scott Michael Scott: How do you untell something? You can't. You can't put words back in your mouth. What you can do is spread false gossip so that people think that everything that's been said is untrue, including Stanley's having an affair. It's like the end of Spartacus; I've seen that movie half a dozen times, and I still don't know who the real Spartacus is. And that is what makes that movie a classic "whodunit".]]> 6 Gossip September 17, 2009 Andy Bernard Andy Bernard: For the record, I prefer women. But off the record, I'm kinda confused.]]> 6 Gossip September 17, 2009 Jim Halpert Jim Halpert: [about Michael, Dwight and Andy doing parkour] The goal is getting from Point A to Point B as creatively as possible, so, technically, they are doing parkour as long as Point A is "delusion" and Point B is "the hospital."]]> 6 Mafia October 15, 2009 Michael Scott Michael Scott: Okay, too many different words coming at me from too many different sentences.]]> 6 The Lover October 22, 2009 Pam Beesly Pam Beesly: Michael, let me make this VERY easy for you. I COULD GIVE A SHIT ABOUT YOUR HAPPIENESS, stop dating my mother!]]> 6 Koi Pond October 29, 2009 Michael Scott Michael Scott: Why would you date an amateur when you can date a professional?]]> 6 Koi Pond October 29, 2009 Michael Scott Michael Scott: I'm not usually the butt of the joke. I'm usually the face of the joke.]]> 6 Double Date November 5, 2009 Andy Bernard Andy Bernard: You give me a gift, bam, thank-you note. You invite me somewhere, pow, RSVP. You do me a favor, wham, favor returned. Do not test my politeness.]]> 6 Double Date November 5, 2009 Michael Scott Michael Scott: As I watched Pam's big, strong hand coming towards my face, I saw my entire life flash before my eyes. And guess what? I have four kids. And I have a hover car and a hover house. And my wife is a runner, and it shows. And Pam and Jim are my best friends, and our kids play together. And I'm happy. And I am rich and I never die. It doesn't sound like much, but it's enough for me.]]> 6 Double Date November 5, 2009 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: [to camera crew] Can't a guy just buy some bagels for his friends, so they'll owe him a favor which he can use to get someone fired who stole a co-manager position from him anymore? Jeez, when did everyone get so cynical?]]> 6 Double Date November 5, 2009 Dwight Schrute Oscar Martinez Andy Bernard Dwight Schrute: What's going on in here?
Oscar Martinez: Andy bought lunch.
Dwight Schrute: Oh, no, really?
Andy Bernard: Yep, yep. Took a page right out of the old Schrute book of niceness.
Dwight Schrute: There is no book; there's only a survival guide.]]> 6 Murder November 12, 2009 Jim Halpert Jim Halpert: Once a year, Dwight holds a seminar updating us on the newest developments in the world of karate. Because, as we all know, the one thing that thousand-year-old martial arts do all the time is change.]]> 6 Murder November 12, 2009 Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert: Okay, with all due respect to everyone here, I think the most worthy opponent of you is you.
Dwight Schrute: That is correct, unless there happen to be measles present.]]> 6 Murder November 12, 2009 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: You know what? You can all have jobs at Schrute Farms as human scarecrows. It doesn't pay much and you can't unionize.]]> 6 Murder November 12, 2009 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: [to the camera crew] I know she didn't do it. It's never the person you most suspect. It's also never the person you least suspect, since anyone with half a brain would suspect them the most. Therefore, I know the killer to be Phyllis, a.k.a. Beatrix Bourbon, the person I most medium suspect.]]> 6 Murder November 12, 2009 Phyllis Lapin Dwight Schrute Michael Scott Phyllis Vance: [in her game character] "I overheard you asking the butler where the pistol was kept."
[Michael gasps]
Dwight Schrute: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. I'm the butler. What, you were listening in on that? Oh, you rich people, you think you can do whatever you want to the servant class!
Michael Scott: No, no, no. Don't turn this into a political thing.
Dwight Schrute: I will poison your food.]]> 6 Scott's Tots December 3, 2009 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: In an ideal world I would have all ten fingers on my left hand so my right hand could just be a fist for punching.]]> 6 Manager and Salesman February 11, 2010 Michael Scott Michael Scott: I have been saying the word 'manager' a lot, so whenever Jo thinks 'manager', she thinks of me. Camel cigarettes did the same with Joe Camel by making him look like a penis. I can't even go near a cigarette now without thinking of a penis. And vice versa.]]> 6 Manager and Salesman February 11, 2010 Jo Bennett Dwight Schrute Jo Bennett: Do you always stay seated when a lady enters the room?
Dwight Schrute: I am treating you the same as a man, for whom I would also not stand. Unless it was the President, or Judge Judy.
Jo Bennett: I like that.]]> 6 St. Patrick's Day March 11, 2010 Michael Scott Michael Scott: It's Saint Patrick's day. Here in Scranton, St. Patty's day is a big deal. It is the closest the Irish will ever have to Christmas.]]> 6 St. Patrick's Day March 11, 2010 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: They say no man is an island. False! I am an island, and this island is volcanic, and it's about to erupt with the hot molten lava of strategy.]]> 6 St. Patrick's Day March 11, 2010 Michael Scott Jo Bennett Michael Scott: I'll be in the other side of this wall if you need me. Just one knock for yes, two knocks for no.
Jo Bennett: How many knocks does it take to get you to do some work?]]> 6 St. Patrick's Day March 11, 2010 Erin Hannon Andy Bernard Erin Hannon: Andy! I'm in my jammy-jams.
Andy Bernard: That's okay. I'm in my worky-works.]]> 6 St. Patrick's Day March 11, 2010 Jo Bennett Jo Bennett: You don't get to be the most powerful woman in Tallahassee by slacking off. You get there by working hard or marrying rich, and I did both.]]> 6 St. Patrick's Day March 11, 2010 Angela Martin Erin Hannon Angela Martin: Are you getting sick?
Erin Hannon: No. It's just indigestion.
Angela Martin: In your nose?]]> 6 St. Patrick's Day March 11, 2010 Jim Halpert Jim Halpert: I'm not surprised Dwight's using my baby to try to get my desk. I'm a little surprised that it's working.]]> 6 Body Language April 29, 2010 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: Just once, I would like to be a puppet master and have nothing go wrong. Is that too much to ask?]]> 6 The Chump May 13, 2010 Dwight Schrute Angela Martin Dwight Schrute: [about their agreement] But not in your bed. It's lumpy.
Angela Martin: Those lumps are cats, and those cats have names. And those names are Amber, Milky Way, Diane, and Lumpy.]]> 6 Whistleblower May 20, 2010 Michael Scott [Michael is on Jo's private jet, as she asks him what has him upset]
Michael Scott: It has not been a blockbuster year for me financially. My Blockbuster stock is down.]]> 7 Nepotism September 23, 2010 Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert: Wow, that's a lot of keys.
Dwight Schrute: The bigger the key chain, the more powerful the man.
Jim Halpert: That's right. The janitor said that.]]> 7 Nepotism September 23, 2010 Creed Bratton Creed Bratton: [explaining why he's following Michael's nephew on Twitter] Everywhere I look is Betty White this, Betty White that. Finally a kid who's not talking about Betty White. Of course I've followed him.]]> 7 Nepotism September 23, 2010 Michael Scott Michael Scott: [slapping his nephew on the butt] You are going to learn to be more professional, Luke!]]> 7 Nepotism September 23, 2010 Gabe Lewis Michael Scott Gabe Lewis: Michael, you've just physically assaulted an employee. Can we talk in private?
Michael Scott: Yes. Of course. What's this in reference to?]]> 7 Nepotism September 23, 2010 Jo Bennett Jo Bennett: Lower yourself, Gabe, I don't wanna be having a conversation with your crotch.]]> 7 Counseling September 30, 2010 Erin Hannon Erin Hannon: [in the "confessional"] Disposable cameras are fun, but it seems a little wasteful. You never get to see your pictures.]]> 7 Counseling September 30, 2010 Phyllis Lapin Phyllis Lapin: I'm glad Michael's getting help. He has a lot of issues and he's stupid.]]> 7 Sex Ed October 14, 2010 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: Now, I'm no doctor, but it seems to me that we all have an obligation to the public health to track down anyone who gives us a disease, inform them of it, and take overwhelming revenge on that person. Again, I'm no doctor. I'm just a normal guy who enjoys revenge.]]> 7 Christening November 4, 2010 Erin Hannon Michael Scott Erin Hannon: [after pulling her car up] Get in, quick!
Michael Scott: Why quick?
Erin Hannon: So it's faster!]]> 7 Viewing Party November 11, 2010 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: In the Schrute family, the youngest child always raises the others. I've been raising children since I was a baby.]]> 7 Viewing Party November 11, 2010 Andy Bernard Andy Bernard: I just ate an entire seahorse! I have to admit, I did not think it was going to work, but it's totally working! I feel exactly like a sea horse! Neighhh gurgle gurgle...]]> 7 WUPHF.com November 18, 2010 Stanley Hudson Stanley Hudson: Yes, I have a dream, and it's not some MLK dream for equality. I want to own a decommissioned lighthouse. And I want to live at the top. And nobody knows I live there. And there's a button that I can press, and launch that lighthouse into space.]]> 7 Classy Christmas December 9, 2010 Kelly Kapoor Kelly Kapoor: Ultimatums are key. Basically nobody does anything for me anymore unless I threaten to kill myself.]]> 7 Ultimatum January 20, 2011 Michael Scott Michael Scott: My resolution? I never wanna make Holly cry again. Unless it's from laughing too hard. Or making love too beautifully.]]> 7 Ultimatum January 20, 2011 Dwight Schrute Darryl Philbin [at a bookstore]
Dwight Schrute: What'd you get?
Darryl Philbin: A book about oceans.
Dwight Schrute: Oh, really? What else? Let me see.
Darryl Philbin: That's porn. Pornography. Old lady. Nasty porn.]]> 7 Threat Level Midnight February 17, 2011 Jim Halpert Michael Scott Goldenface (Jim): Sorry about your friend, Scarn.
Michael Scarn: The joke's on you, Goldenface. That man was a wanted animal rapist.]]> 7 Threat Level Midnight February 17, 2011 Michael Scott Jim Halpert Michael Scarn: Hey, Goldenface.
Goldenface (Jim): Yeah?
Michael Scarn: Go puck yourself.]]> 7 Threat Level Midnight February 17, 2011 Todd Packer Drunk Man in Bar (Todd Packer): If doing the Scarn is gay, then I'm the biggest queer on Earth!]]> 7 Threat Level Midnight February 17, 2011 Michael Scott Michael Scott: I am a huge Woody Allen fan. Although I've only seen "Antz." But I'll tell you something, what I respect about that man is that when he was going through all of that stuff that came out in the press, about how "Antz" was just a ripoff of "A Bug's Life," he stayed true to his films. Or at least the film that I saw, which, again, was "Antz." Thing is, I thought "A Bug's Life" was better, much better than "Antz." Point is, don't listen to your critics. Listen to your fans.]]> 7 Threat Level Midnight February 17, 2011 Michael Scott Holly Flax Michael Scott: But, you know what? When I think about it, when I really think about it, none of those things are as real to me as my movie.
Holly Flax: I'm real.
Michael Scott: Yeah, you're a real pain in the ass.]]> 7 Todd Packer February 24, 2011 Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute: All right, picture this. Snowy ash drizzles from the sky. A rabid pack of dogs surrounds you as the flame at the end of your stick dies out. There's only one hope for you: the door to my shelter. You pound. You beg. "Dwight, please let me in." But I ignore your cries and do not let you in. You want to know why?
Jim Halpert: Because of the sign that says, "No pounding, no begging."]]> 7 Todd Packer February 24, 2011 Holly Flaxt Ryan Howard Kelly Kapoor Holly Flax: [about Todd Packer] Okay, look, we can't fire someone because we don't like him.
Ryan Howard: Right. This isn't the U.S. government.
Kelly Kapoor: What are you referencing?
Ryan Howard: Everything. Everything.]]> 7 Todd Packer February 24, 2011 Todd Packer Kevin Malone [as Kevin, Holly, and Dwight are eating in the kitchen]
Todd Packer: Hey, what's going on, you guys? Yeah. Three muske-queers.
Kevin Malone: Mean, but good.]]> 7 Todd Packer February 24, 2011 Kevin Malone Todd Packer Kevin Malone: [to Todd] Your life is so insane. You should write a book.
Todd Packer: Since when did you learn how to read?
Kevin Malone: [still smiling] I do know how to read, though.
Todd Packer: Yeah. You know how to read a menu. This guy...]]> 7 Todd Packer February 24, 2011 Kevin Malone Dwight Schrute Kevin Malone: [referring to Todd Packer's comments about his weight] I... He's right. I mean, I could lose some weight.
Dwight Schrute: Kevin, in sumo culture, you'd be considered a promising up-and-comer.]]> 7 Todd Packer February 24, 2011 Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute [deliberating how to get back at Todd]
Jim Halpert: All right, well, this isn't my best, but call Froggy 101, say that we're the tour manager for Justin Bieber, and we're giving away free tickets. We give them a number to call for the tickets, and it's his number.
Dwight Schrute: Who is Justice Beaver?
Jim Halpert: He... It's a crime-fighting beaver.]]> 7 Garage Sale March 24, 2011 Angela Martin Holly Flax Michael Scott Angela Martin: Will you marry me?
Holly Flax: No.
Michael Scott: That would be hot. I'd pay to see that.]]> 7 Goodbye, Michael April 28, 2011 Michael Scott Michael Scott: [Michael's last line] Oh, this is gonna feel so good getting this thing off my chest... that's what she said.]]> 7 Goodbye, Michael April 28, 2011 Michael Scott Michael Scott: [to the documentary crew] Hey, will you guys let me know if this ever airs?]]> 7 Goodbye, Michael April 28, 2011 Michael Scott Toby Flenderson: Well, you know Michael, I have a brother in Boulder, Rory Flenderson. You should look him up.
Michael Scott: [through his teeth] Okay...]]> 7 Goodbye, Michael April 28, 2011 Jim Halpert Jim Halpert: So you guys are filming us when we go to the bathroom now?]]> 7 Search Committee May 19, 2011 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: I will run this branch or I will destroy this branch. Or... I don't know. Something always works out.]]> 7 Search Committee May 19, 2011 Robert California Robert California: There is only sex. Everything is sex. Do you understand that what I'm telling you is a universal truth?]]> 7 Search Committee May 19, 2011 Robert California Robert California: Do I look like someone who would waste my own time?]]> 7 Search Committee May 19, 2011 Jim Halpert Jim Halpert: [referring to Robert California] He creeps me out, but I think he's a genius.]]> 7 Search Committee May 19, 2011 Ryan Howard Ryan Howard: I got away with everything under the last boss and it wasn't good for me. So I want guidance. I want leadership. Lead me... when I'm in the mood to be led.]]> 8 The List September 22, 2011 Robert California Robert California: Let me tell you some things I find productive. Positive reinforcement. Negative reinforcement. Honesty. I'll tell you some things I find unproductive. Constantly worrying about where you stand based on inscrutable social clues and then inevitably reframing it all in a reassuring way so that you can get to sleep at night. No I do not believe in that at all. If I invited you to lunch I think you're a winner, if I didn't I don't, but I just met you all. Life is long, opinions change. Winners prove me right. Losers prove me wrong.]]> 8 Spooked October 27, 2011 Robert California Robert California: Fear plays an interesting role in our lives. How dare we let it motivate us? How dare we let it into our decision-making, into our livelihoods, into our relationships? It's funny isn't it, we take a day a year to dress up in costume and celebrate fear?]]> 8 Mrs. California December 1, 2011 Ryan Howard Mrs. California: All right, well, it's really nice to meet you, Bryan.
Ryan Howard: Uh, it's actually Ryan.
Mrs. California: Oh, Ryan.
Ryan Howard: [later, while being interviewed] Bitch...]]> `, (err, result) => { //console.log(JSON.stringify(result.quotes.quote, null, 4)); return objectToJson(result.quotes.quote); }); } function objectToJson(json) { let result = {}; json.map(quote => { let formattedQuote = formatQuote(quote); if (result.hasOwnProperty(quote.character[0])) { return result[quote.character[0]].push(formattedQuote); } else { return result[quote.character[0]] = [formattedQuote]; } }); console.log(JSON.stringify(result)); } function formatQuote(quote) { if (quote.character) {} return quote; }

sourcesContent:
import {parseString} from 'xml2js'; export default function getXmlQuotes(){ parseString(` 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Angela Martin Kevin Malone [Worried about downsizing]
Angela: I think it's going to be me... It'll probably be me...
Kevin: Yeah, it'll be you.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: [after bringing Pam to tears by saying she's fired] You've been X'd punk!]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Jim Halpert Pam Beesly Jim Halpert: If I left, what would I do with all this useless information in my head? You know? Tonnage price of manila folders? Um, Pam's favorite flavor of yogurt? Which is mixed berry.
Pam Beesly: Jim said mixed berries? Oh wow... Yeah, he's on to me.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Todd Packer Todd Packer: Does the carpet match the drapes?]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: ...it's really beyond words. It's really incalculacable.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Dwight Schrute [Jim set a fence of pencils up between Dwight and his desk]
Dwight Schrute: You can't do that. Safety violation. I could fall and pierce an organ.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: This is our receptionist, Pam. If you think she's cute now, you should have seen her a couple years ago.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: What is the most important thing for a company? Is it the cash flow? Is it the inventory? Nuh-uh. It's the people. The people. My proudest moment here was not when I increased profits by 17% or when I cut expenses without losing a single employee. No, no, no, no, no. It was a young Guatemalan guy. First job in the country, barely spoke English. He came to me, and said, "Mr. Scott, would you be the godfather of my child?" Wow. Wow. Didn't work out. We had to let him go. He sucked.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: I guess the atmosphere that I've tried to create here is that I'm a friend first and a boss second, and probably an entertainer third.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Pam Beesly Pam Beesly: I don't think it would be the worst thing if they let me go. Because then I might...
[pauses]
Pam Beesly: It's just... I don't think it's many girls' dream to be a receptionist.]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute: Damn it! Jim! He put my stuff in Jell-O again.
[Points to Michael]
Dwight Schrute: You can be a witness. Can you reprimand him, please?
Jim Halpert: [eating Jell-O] How do you know it was me?]]> 1 Pilot March 24, 2005 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: Downsizing? I have no problem with that. I have been recommending downsizing since I first got here. I even brought it up in my interview. I say, bring it on.]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Dwight Schrute Mr. Brown: Now this is a simple acronym: H.E.R.O. At Diversity, we believe it's very easy to be a hero. All you need are: Honesty, Empathy, Respect, and Open-mindedness.
Dwight Schrute: Excuse me, I'm sorry, but that's not all it takes to be a hero.
Mr. Brown: Okay well, what is a hero to you?
Dwight Schrute: A hero kills people, people that wish him harm. A hero is part human and part supernatural. A hero is born out of a childhood trauma, or out of a disaster, and must be avenged.
Mr. Brown: Uh, okay, you're thinking of a superhero.]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Michael Scott Kevin Malone Michael Scott: [during Diversity Day] God, I don't know... Maybe I should have gotten some food or something.
Kevin: [wearing the Italian card on his head] Maybe some spaghetti.
Michael Scott: No, Kevin, stop with Diversity Day for a second!]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: Abraham Lincoln once said that "If you're a racist, I will attack you with the North," and these are the principles I carry with me in the workplace.]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Dwight Schrute Pam Beesly Pam Beesly: [during a Diversity Day excerise, Dwight has been appointed Chinese without knowing what race he has been assigned] Based on stereotypes that are completely untrue, you may be a bad driver.
Dwight Schrute: Oh, man! Am I a woman?]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Toby Flenderson Michael Scott Toby Flenderson: [joking] Hey, we're not all going to sit in a circle Indian style, are we?
Michael Scott: [serious] Get out.
Toby Flenderson: Oh. Sorry.
Michael Scott: No. This is not a joke. What you said was offensive... and lame, so double offense. This is a place of welcoming, and... you should just get the hell out of here.]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: You'll notice I didn't have anybody being Arab. I thought that would be too explosive. No pun intended. But I just thought, "Too soon for Arabs." Maybe next year. Um... You know, the ball's in their court.]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Oscar Martinez Michael Scott Oscar: Both my parents were born in Mexico. And they moved to the United States a year before I was born. So I grew up in the United States. My parents were Mexican.
Michael Scott: Wow. Wow. That is... That is a great story. That's the American dream right there, right? Um, let me ask you, is there a term besides "Mexican" that you prefer? Something less offensive?]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: I am Michael, and I am part English, Irish, German, and Scottish. Sort of a virtual United Nations.]]> 1 Diversity Day March 29, 2005 Stanley Hudson Michael Scott Stanley: It's collard greens.
Michael Scott: What?
Stanley: It's collard greens.
Michael Scott: That doesn't really make any sense. You don't call them collard people. That's offensive.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Kevin Malone Angela Martin [Michael doesn't want to come out of his office]
Kevin: He has to come out sometime... to go to the bathroom!
Angela: Kevin, that's inappropriate!]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Jim Halpert Pam Beesly Jim Halpert: Wait, what are you writing? Don't write ebola or mad cow disease, all right? Because I'm suffering from both of them.
Pam Beesly: I'm inventing new diseases.
Jim Halpert: Oh, great.
Pam Beesly: So, like, let's say that my teeth turn to liquid and then they drip down the back of my throat. What would you call that?
Jim Halpert: I thought you said you were inventing new diseases. That's spontaneous dental hydroplosion.
Pam Beesly: Nice.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Jim Halpert Jim Halpert: Right now, this is just a job. If I advance any higher in this company, then this would be my career. And, well, if this were my career? I'd have to throw myself in front of a train.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute: The problem, Jim, is that people who are really suffering from a medical condition won't receive the care they need because someone in this office is coming up with ridiculous stuff. "Count Choculitis?"
Jim Halpert: Sounds tough.
Dwight Schrute: Why did you write that down, Jim? Is it because you know I love Count Chocula?]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: What did I do? I did my job. I slashed benefits to the bone; I saved this company money. Was I too harsh? Maybe. I don't believe in coddling people. In the wild, there is no Health Care. In the wild, Health Care is: ow, I hurt my leg; I can't run; a lion eats me, and I'm dead. Well, I'm not dead. I'm the lion. You're dead.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Dwight Schrute Pam Beesly Dwight Schrute: Through concentration, I can raise and lower my cholesterol at will.
Pam Beesly: Why would you want to raise your cholesterol?
Dwight Schrute: So I can lower it.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute: Someone forged medical information, and that is a felony.
Jim Halpert: Okay. Whoa, all right, 'cause that's a pretty intense accusation. How do you know that they're fake?
Dwight Schrute: [reading from a sheet] Uh, "Leprosy. Flesh-eating bacteria. Hot-dog fingers. Government-created killer nanorobot infection."]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: The most sacred thing I do is care and provide for my workers, my family.
[... ]
Michael Scott: Today, I am in charge of picking a great new healthcare plan. Right? That's what this is all about. Does that make me their doctor? Um... Yes, in a way. Yeah. Like a specialist.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Jan Levinson Michael Scott Jan Levinson: Sometimes a manager like yourself has to deliver the bad news to the employees. I do it all the time.
Michael Scott: When have you ever done that?
Jan Levinson: I'm doing it right now. To you.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Dwight Schrute Michael Scott Dwight Schrute: Okay. First, let's go over some parameters. How many people can I fire?
Michael Scott: Uh, none. You're picking a healthcare plan.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute: Please knock. This is an office.
Jim Halpert: [pointing to sign] It says "workspace."
Dwight Schrute: Same thing.
Jim Halpert: If it's the same thing, then why'd you write "workspace"?]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Dwight Schrute Meredith Palmer Dwight Schrute: Number one: Inverted penis.
Meredith: Could you mean vagina? Because if you do, I want that covered.
Dwight Schrute: I thought your vagina was removed during your hysterectomy.
Meredith: A uterus is different from a vagina. I still have a vagina.]]> 1 Health Care April 5, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: I learned improv from the greats, like Drew Carey and Ryan Stiles.]]> 1 The Alliance April 12, 2005 Dwight Schrute Jim Halpert Dwight Schrute: Did you get your tickets?
Jim Halpert: To what?
Dwight Schrute: The gun show. [lifts up his sleeve and kisses his arm]]]> 1 The Alliance April 12, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: No, I'm not going to tell them about the downsizing. As a doctor, you wouldn't tell a patient that they had cancer.]]> 1 The Alliance April 12, 2005 Pam Beesly Pam Beesly: This was tough. I suggested we flip a coin, but Angela said she doesn't like to gamble. Of course, by saying that, she was gambling that I wouldn't smack her.]]> 1 The Alliance April 12, 2005 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: I'm a deer hunter, I go all the time with my dad. One thing about deer? They have very good vision. One thing about me? I'm better at hiding than they are at vision.]]> 1 The Alliance April 12, 2005 Michael Scott Michael Scott: You know, if I were allergic to dairy, I think I'd kill myself.]]> 1 The Alliance April 12, 2005 Michael Scott Dwight Schrute Michael Scott: I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.
Dwight Schrute: She had a hysterectomy.
Michael Scott: Which one is that again?
Dwight Schrute: That's when they remove the uterus.
Michael Scott: Oh, God! Dwight, no.]]> 1 The Alliance April 12, 2005 Dwight Schrute Dwight Schrute: It's a real shame, 'cause studies have shown that more information is passed through water-cooler gossip than through official memos, which puts me at a disadvantage because...
[picks up water bottle]
Dwight Schrute: I bring my own water to work.]]> 1 Basketball April 19, 2005 Oscar Martinez Michael Scott [Michael attempts to assemble a basketball team and Oscar, of Mexican descent, approaches]
Oscar: I can help out if you need me.
